qas.question: What did John Calvin claim Jesus could have done?
Why did Jesus submit to crucifixion?
The Eastern Church believes what regarding the death and ressurection?
What did Jesus's death accomplish per the Eastern Church?

answers.text: redeem humanity from the disgrace caused by the fall of Adam

qas.question: What is the blood of the lamb?

answers.text: had a cleansing nature, similar to baptismal water

qas.question: What kind of Christology was supported by Karl Rahner?
What did Karl Rahner believe Jesus could have successfully argued for?
According to Rahner how did Jesus submit during his trial?
How did John Calvin believe the crucifixion was determined?
What was the blood of Jesus similar to according to John Calvin?

context: John Calvin supported the <b5_0>"agent of God"<b5_0/> Christology and argued that in his trial in Pilate's Court Jesus could have <a0_0>successfully argued for <b6_0>his innocence<b6_0/><a0_0/>, but instead submitted to crucifixion <b7_0>in <a1_0>obedience to the Father<b7_0/><a1_0/>. This Christological theme continued into the 20th century, both in the Eastern and Western Churches. In the Eastern Church Sergei Bulgakov argued that the crucifixion of Jesus was <a2_0><b8_0>"pre-eternally"<b8_0/> determined by the Father<a2_0/> before the creation of the world, to <a3_0>redeem humanity from the disgrace caused by the fall of Adam<a3_0/>. In the Western Church, Karl Rahner elaborated on the analogy that the blood of the Lamb of God (and the water from the side of Jesus) shed at the crucifixion <a4_0>had a cleansing nature, similar to <b9_0>baptismal water<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
